page.title: 03LIVING IN BRENTWOOD
page.content:
{ The majority of pensioners who have lived in Brentwood for most of their lives say they prefer the{old {Brentwood}compared to the modern one, as the character seems to have disappeared.
The{disadvantages}include the lack of parking space, not enough good clothes shops or enough to do at night or after school. Many young women who are on low limited income thought that the clothes shops for young children were too few and expensive.
The{middle-aged}community in Brentwood thought that the shopping precinct had a lot to offer in the way of household goods. Many wives and mothers wanted a larger store which gives a variety of things ranging from clothes to make-up
